main.java.latexee.parsers

Class DeclarationParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.latexee.parsers.DeclarationParser

  • public class DeclarationParser
extends java.lang.Object
    DeclarationParser class contains methods for finding and parsing the operator and macro declarations. Example of a macro declaration \declare{macro=\frac, meaning=arith1.divide, argspec=[2], code={...}} Example of a operator declaration \declare{syntax={infix, 7, /, l}, meaning=arith1.divide} Declarations are after translated to grammar rules.

      DeclarationParser()

    • Method Detail

      • declarationFinder

        public static void declarationFinder(ParsedStatement node)
        This method traverses the given AST and finds all declarations. Work is delegated to different method with same signature.
        Parameters:
        node - entry node to tree containing all statements

      • declarationFinder

        public static java.lang.Integer declarationFinder(ParsedStatement node,
                                                  java.lang.Integer maxId)
        This method is only used for testing purposes. Static method to find all the macro and operator declarations in the statement tree.
        Parameters:
        node - entry node to statements branch
        maxId - amount of declarations parsed
        Returns:
        integer of how many operator or macro declarations were found

      • isOperatorSyntax

        public static boolean isOperatorSyntax(org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTree tree)
        This method is only used for testing purposes. Method to find if the declaration contains operator syntax.
        Parameters:
        tree - statement node
        Returns:
        true if node is operator statement, false if not operator then it should be macro statement

      • parseDeclaration

        public static org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTree parseDeclaration(java.lang.String rule)
        After we have found our declarations we will generate ANTLR parse tree for each declaration string.
        Parameters:
        rule - declaration in string format
        Returns:
        parse tree of the declaration.
